body:
@brson So should we pipe the value through e.g. md5sum?

That could be awkward on BSDs, where the hash programs have a [different naming convention and interface](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1299833/bsd-md5-vs-gnu-md5sum-output-format).

I think we can patch over the differences by adding a check to the configure script. Something like this:

``` sh
# Use `md5sum` on GNU platforms, and `md5 -q` on BSD
system_md5sum=$(which md5sum)
system_md5=$(which md5)
if [ -n "$system_md5sum" ]
then
    CFG_HASH_COMMAND="$system_md5sum | head -c 8"
elif [ -n "$system_md5" ]
then
    CFG_HASH_COMMAND="$system_md5 -q | head -c 8"
else
    err 'either `md5sum` or `md5` must be installed'
fi
putvar CFG_HASH_COMMAND
```

then in the Makefile we have:

``` make
CFG_FILENAME_EXTRA=$(shell echo -n $(CFG_RELEASE) | $(CFG_HASH_COMMAND))
```

But if there's a simpler way then I'm all ears.
